SEARCH
Module clientCLI
Package com.etiennecollin.ift2255.clientCLI.models

Class ShopModel

java.lang.Object
com.etiennecollin.ift2255.clientCLI.models.ShopModel
public class ShopModel extends Object
The ShopModel class represents the models for managing shopping-related operations in the CLI application. It includes methods for retrieving products, adding products to the cart, processing orders, and handling order-related tasks.

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Field

  • Constructor Details

    • ShopModel

      public ShopModel(Database database)
      Constructs a new ShopModel with the specified database.
      Parameters:
      database - The database used by the models to store shopping-related data.

  • Method Details

    • getProduct

      public <T extends Product> T getProduct(Class<T> productClass, UUID productId)
      Retrieves a product of the specified class with the given product ID from the database.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of product to retrieve.
      Parameters:
      productClass - The class representing the type of product to retrieve.
      productId - The unique identifier of the product to retrieve.
      Returns:
      The product of the specified class with the given ID, or null if not found or the retrieved product does not match the specified class.

    • checkProductPromotion

      public void checkProductPromotion(UUID productId)
      Checks and updates the promotion status of a product based on its promotion end date.
      Parameters:
      productId - The unique identifier of the product to check for promotion.

    • getProducts

      public List<Product> getProducts()
      Retrieves a list of all products in the database.
      Returns:
      A list containing all products.

    • getProducts

      public List<Product> getProducts(ProductCategory category, Enum<?> subCategory, UUID sellerId)
      Retrieves a list of products based on specified criteria.
      Parameters:
      category - The product category (can be null).
      subCategory - The product sub-category (can be null).
      sellerId - The unique identifier of the seller (can be null).
      Returns:
      A list of products that match the specified criteria.

    • searchProducts

      public List<Product> searchProducts(Predicate<Product> predicate)
      Searches for products based on a custom predicate.
      Parameters:
      predicate - The predicate used to filter products.
      Returns:
      A list of products that match the specified predicate.

    • createNewBookOrManual

      public OperationResult createNewBookOrManual(UUID sellerId, int price, int quantity, String title, String description, int fidelityPoints, String isbn, String author, String editor, BookOrManualGenre genre, LocalDate releaseDate, int editionNumber, int volumeNumber)
      Creates a new book or manual product and adds it to the database.
      Parameters:
      sellerId - The unique identifier of the seller.
      price - The price of the product.
      quantity - The quantity of the product.
      title - The title of the product.
      description - The description of the product.
      fidelityPoints - The fidelity points associated with the product.
      isbn - The ISBN of the book or manual.
      author - The author of the book or manual.
      editor - The editor of the book or manual.
      genre - The genre of the book or manual.
      releaseDate - The release date of the book or manual.
      editionNumber - The edition number of the book or manual.
      volumeNumber - The volume number of the book or manual.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating the success or failure of the operation.

    • createNewITProduct

      public OperationResult createNewITProduct(UUID sellerId, int price, int quantity, String title, String description, int fidelityPoints, String brand, String model, LocalDate releaseDate, ITCategory subCategory)
      Creates a new IT product and adds it to the database.
      Parameters:
      sellerId - The unique identifier of the seller.
      price - The price of the product.
      quantity - The quantity of the product.
      title - The title of the product.
      description - The description of the product.
      fidelityPoints - The fidelity points associated with the product.
      brand - The brand of the IT product.
      model - The models of the IT product.
      releaseDate - The release date of the IT product.
      subCategory - The sub-category of the IT product.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating the success or failure of the operation.

    • createNewLearningResource

      public OperationResult createNewLearningResource(UUID sellerId, int price, int quantity, String title, String description, int fidelityPoints, String isbn, String organisation, LocalDate releaseDate, LearningResourceType type, int editionNumber)

      Parameters:
      sellerId - The unique identifier of the seller.
      price - The price of the product.
      quantity - The quantity of the product.
      title - The title of the product.
      description - The description of the product.
      fidelityPoints - The fidelity points associated with the product.
      isbn - The ISBN of the learning resource.
      organisation - The organization associated with the learning resource.
      releaseDate - The release date of the learning resource.
      type - The type of the learning resource.
      editionNumber - The edition number of the learning resource.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating the success or failure of the operation.

    • startProductPromotion

      public OperationResult startProductPromotion(UUID productId, int discount, int promoPoints, LocalDate endDate)
      Initiates a promotion for a product with the specified product ID.
      Parameters:
      productId - The unique identifier of the product to promote.
      discount - The discount percentage to apply to the product's price.
      promoPoints - The amount of promotional fidelity points to award with the purchase of this product during the promotion.
      endDate - The end date of the promotion.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating the success or failure of the operation.

    • addToCart

      public OperationResult addToCart(UUID buyerId, UUID productId, int quantity, Database cartDb)
      Adds a specified quantity of a product to the user's cart.
      Parameters:
      buyerId - The unique identifier of the buyer.
      productId - The unique identifier of the product.
      quantity - The quantity to add to the cart.
      cartDb - An optional database for manipulating the cart. If null, the normal database is used.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating the success or failure of the operation.

    • validateQuantity

      private OperationResult validateQuantity(Product product, int quantity)
      Validates the specified quantity for a product, checking if it is greater than 0 and does not exceed the available stock.
      Parameters:
      product - The product to validate the quantity for.
      quantity - The quantity to validate.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating the validation result. If the quantity is valid, the result is marked as successful; otherwise, it contains an error message.

    • removeFromCart

      public OperationResult removeFromCart(UUID cartProductId, int quantity, Database cartDb)
      Removes a specified quantity of a product from the user's cart.
      Parameters:
      cartProductId - The unique identifier of the cart product.
      quantity - The quantity to remove from the cart.
      cartDb - An optional database for manipulating the cart. If null, the normal database is used.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating the success or failure of the operation.

    • costAfterFidelityPoints

      public Tuple<Integer,Integer> costAfterFidelityPoints(int cost, int fidelityPoints)
      Calculates the remaining cost left to pay and the unused fidelity points.
      Parameters:
      cost - The amount to pay.
      fidelityPoints - The amount of fidelity points available.
      Returns:
      A tuple containing the remaining cost and the remaining fidelity points.

    • createOrders

      public OperationResult createOrders(UUID buyerId, String email, String phone, String shippingAddress, String billingAddress, String creditCardName, String creditCardNumber, YearMonth creditCardExpiration, String creditCardCVC, int fidelityPointsUsed)
      Processes the creation of orders based on the items in the user's cart.
      Parameters:
      buyerId - The unique identifier of the buyer.
      email - The email address for order communication.
      phone - The phone number for order communication.
      shippingAddress - The shipping address for the order.
      billingAddress - The billing address for the order.
      creditCardName - The name on the credit card used for payment.
      creditCardNumber - The credit card number used for payment.
      creditCardExpiration - The expiration date of the credit card.
      creditCardCVC - The CVC code of the credit card.
      fidelityPointsUsed - The amount of fidelity points used in the order.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating the success or failure of the operation.

    • getCart

      public List<Tuple<CartProduct,Product>> getCart(UUID buyerId)
      Retrieves the products in the user's cart along with associated details.
      Parameters:
      buyerId - The unique identifier of the buyer.
      Returns:
      A list of tuples containing cart product details and associated product information.

    • emptyCart

      public OperationResult emptyCart(UUID buyerId)
      Empties the user's cart.
      Parameters:
      buyerId - The unique identifier of the buyer.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating the success or failure of the operation.

    • getOrder

      public Order getOrder(UUID orderId)
      Retrieves an order by its order ID.
      Parameters:
      orderId - The unique identifier of the order.
      Returns:
      The matching order or null.

    • getOrders

      public List<Order> getOrders(UUID buyerId, UUID sellerId)
      Retrieves orders based on specified criteria.
      Parameters:
      buyerId - The unique identifier of the buyer (can be null).
      sellerId - The unique identifier of the seller (can be null).
      Returns:
      A list of orders that match the specified criteria.

    • getOrders

      public List<Order> getOrders(Predicate<Order> predicate)
      Retrieves orders based on a custom predicate.
      Parameters:
      predicate - The predicate used to filter orders.
      Returns:
      A list of orders that match the specified predicate.

    • shipOrder

      public OperationResult shipOrder(UUID orderId, String shippingCompany, String trackingNumber, LocalDate expectedDeliveryDate)
      Updates the shipment information for a specific order, marking it as in transit.
      Parameters:
      orderId - The unique identifier of the order.
      shippingCompany - The shipping company used for the shipment.
      trackingNumber - The tracking number associated with the shipment.
      expectedDeliveryDate - The expected delivery date of the shipment.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating the success or failure of the operation.

    • confirmDelivery

      public OperationResult confirmDelivery(UUID orderId)
      Marks a specific order as delivered.
      Parameters:
      orderId - The unique identifier of the order.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating the success or failure of the operation.

    • cancelOrder

      public OperationResult cancelOrder(UUID orderId)
      Cancels a specific order that is still in production.
      Parameters:
      orderId - The unique identifier of the order.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating the success or failure of the operation.

    • validateQuantity

      public OperationResult validateQuantity(UUID productId, int quantity)
      Validates the quantity for a specified product.
      Parameters:
      productId - The unique identifier of the product.
      quantity - The quantity to validate.
      Returns:
      An OperationResult indicating the validity of the quantity.
